p.s: Description of Roseibacillus ponti sp. nov.
Roseibacillus ponti (pon′ti. L. gen. n. ponti of the sea).
Main characteristics are the same as those given for the genus.
In addition, cells are 0.7–0.8 μm wide and 1.2–1.5 μm long.
Neither cellular gliding movement nor swarming growth is observed.
Colonies grown on 1/2-strength R2A agar with 75 % artificial seawater are circular, convex and reddish pink in colour.
The temperature range for growth is 15–37 °C, with optimal growth at 30–37 °C.
No growth occurs at either 4 or 45 °C.
The pH range for growth is 7.0–9.0.
NaCl is required for growth and can be tolerated up to 7 % (w/v).

Alkaline phosphatase, esterase lipase (C8) and naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase tests are positive, but esterase (C4), leucine arylamidase, acid phosphatase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, α-glucosidase, valine arylamidase, trypsin, lipase (C4), cystine arylamidase, chymotrypsin, β-glucuronidase, β-glucosidase, α-mannosidase and α-fucosidase tests are negative.

Dextrin, l-arabinose, d-fructose, d-galactose, d-glucose, d-lactose, lactulose, d-mannitol, d-mannose, furanose, d-galacturonic acid, α-ketoglutaric acid, dl-carnitine, γ-aminobutyric acid, uridine, thymidine, 2,3-butanediol, glycerol and dl-α-glycerol phosphate are oxidized.
The cell-wall peptidoglycan contains muramic acid and meso-diaminopimelic acid.
The G+C content of the genomic DNA of the type strain is 57.6 mol%.
The type strain is YM27-120T (=MBIC08316T =KCTC 12987T), which was isolated from a brown alga.
